summary: T Mark Flanagan was an employee of the U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA). He is listed in multiple payroll and certification reports from October 1977 to February 1979. These documents detail Flanagan's position and salary during his time with the committee. The consistent appearance of his name across multiple payroll certifications indicates his continued employment with the HSCA during this period.
significance: T Mark Flanagan's significance lies in his employment with the HSCA, the congressional committee tasked with investigating the assassination of President John F. Kennedy. While the specific nature of his role is not detailed in the provided documents, his presence on the payroll indicates he contributed to the committee's operations.
